articles.author: Ryan Whitwam
articles.title: Glass redux: Google aims to avoid past mistakes as it brings Gemini to your face - Ars Technica
articles.description: Google didn’t get it right with Glass, but Android XR is ready for the AI era, even if you aren’t.

articles.author: Jennifer Ouellette
articles.title: Infrared contact lenses let you see in the dark - Ars Technica
articles.description: Mice and humans were able to detect infrared light, even with their eyes closed, with limited resolution.

articles.author: Ivan Mehta
articles.title: Signal’s new Windows update prevents the system from capturing screenshots of chats - TechCrunch
articles.description: Signal said today that it is updating its Windows app to prevent the system from capturing screenshots, thereby protecting the content that is on display.
articles.content:
Signal said today that it is updating its Windows app to prevent the system from capturing screenshots, thereby protecting the content that is on display.

articles.description: The ZEUS laser facility at the University of Michigan has vaulted the United States to the forefront of high-intensity laser science. In its first official experiment, ZEUS...
